metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9514 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to a reset flood, potentiallyleading to a denial of service. The attacker opens a number of streams andsends an invalid request over each stream that should solicit a stream ofRST_STREAM frames from the peer. Depending on how the peer queues theRST_STREAM frames, this can consume excess memory, CPU, or both.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9514` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-twisted - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
python3-twisted-bin - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
No subscription required

trafficserver - 8.0.5+ds-1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 8.0.5+ds-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

h2o - 2.2.5+dfsg2-3
libh2o-evloop0.13 - 2.2.5+dfsg2-3
libh2o0.13 - 2.2.5+dfsg2-3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

libnode72 - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3
nodejs - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netty package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and needs fixing.
grpc package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and needs fixing.
golang-google-grpc package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and needs fixing.
twisted package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '18.9.0-6ubuntu1').
trafficserver package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.5+ds-1').
h2o package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.5+dfsg2-3').
nodejs package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3').
